oai_dc:dc.dc:title: INFLUENCE OF GRAIN SIZE ON LITTORAL DRIFT
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Castanho, Jose
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: littoral drift
grain size
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Influence of grain size in sediment transport depends on flow conditions For bed load transport a maximum probably exists for load discharge as a function of gram size The important parameter seems to be the ratio To/T between the threshold shear stress and the flow shear stress.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 12 (1970): Proceedings of 12th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Washington, D.C., 1970.; 56
